questions.question: What was the major update Jesse Pollak announced regarding documentation for the Node.js SDK on 2026-01-02?
options: Automated publishing, links to API reference, and a 'Try it now' experience.
Consolidated API reference pages into a single large markdown file.
Added support for Python and Rust SDKs simultaneously.
Implemented natural language search functionality for all documentation.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (1/2/26) mentioned automating documentation publishing for the Node.js SDK, including linking API reference pages and providing an easy 'Try it now' experience.

questions.question: According to Dan Romero's analysis on value capture in crypto swaps (2026-01-09), which of the four primary places to make money is currently the most lucrative?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (1/9/26) stated that the UI layer is the most lucrative today, but faces the most pricing pressure and competition.

questions.question: What is one of Brian Armstrong's specific steps mentioned in his daily routine on 2026-01-08?
options: Checking the trending tokens list on Coinbase.
questions.explanation: Brian Armstrong (1/8/26) mentioned his routine includes pulling a daily tarot card and buying a megapot if he gets a lucky card.

questions.question: Jesse Pollak noted that the simplified webhook configuration updates (2025-12-23) were powered by which underlying tool, which will also power the App Studio agent?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (12/23/25) specified that the same MCP tool powering dev.neynar.com would also power the App Studio agent.

questions.question: What specific capability was Brian Armstrong looking for in an LLM API endpoint from Neynar on 2025-12-28?
questions.explanation: Brian Armstrong (12/28/25) asked Neynar if they had an API endpoint for an LLM with Farcaster knowledge.

questions.question: What were the two core stacks Dan Romero described in the 'Crypto barbells expanded' framework on 2026-01-09?
options: White Hat Stack and Black Hat Stack.
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (1/9/26) outlined that 'You're either in speculation stack or stablecoin stack.'

questions.question: Which exchange did Jesse Pollak cite as having the lowest market order spread (0.85%) on BTC/USD or BTC/USDC pairs among the two he mentioned on 2026-01-06?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (1/6/26) cited Coinbase Advanced at 1% and Robinhood at 0.85%.

questions.question: What general theme did Jesse Pollak emphasize with his quote 'from 1 to N - build more!' on 2026-01-08?
options: Scaling adoption and encouraging continuous development.
Transitioning from L1 to L2 infrastructure.
questions.explanation: This quote is a general encouragement for builders to scale their efforts.

questions.question: What was the progression of chain interaction Jesse Pollak outlined in December 2025 regarding Farcaster development?
options: We write to a chain now, we read from a chain next.
We read a chain now, we write to a chain next.
We deploy to a chain now, we manage state next.
We query a chain now, we broadcast to a chain next.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (12/4/25) explicitly stated, 'We read a chain now, we write to a chain next.'

questions.question: According to Dan Romero's post (2026-01-09), what specific infrastructure issue is the big issue for 'CLARITY' (legislation)?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (1/9/26) stated, 'Hearing that the big issue for CLARITY is revisiting stablecoin yield ("rewards").'

questions.question: According to the Anthropic report Jesse Pollak cited (2025-12-02), what percentage of post-March 2025 blockchain exploits could have been executed autonomously by current AI agents?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (12/2/25) quoted the report figure: '55.88%—a leap from $5,000 to $4.6 million in total exploit revenue.'

questions.question: Jesse Pollak mentioned that the @neynar/ui was primarily made for whom, despite being curated by humans?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (1/5/26) said the UI was 'made for the bots, curated by the humans at neynar.'

questions.question: Dan Romero mentioned that Base is now the most popular client on the Farcaster protocol based on what specific metric?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (12/18/25) noted, 'Base is now the most popular client on protocol by messages sent.'

questions.question: What product update did Jesse Pollak suggest developers should utilize to 'build something over the holidays' (2025-12-24)?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (12/24/25) specifically mentioned 'App Studio updates for you to build something over the holidays.'

questions.question: What type of market activity did Jesse Pollak state he wants to *resolve*, rather than make or bet on (2025-12-17)?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (12/17/25) posted: 'everyone wants to make or bet on prediction markets. i want to resolve them.'

questions.question: What two new methods for interacting with 'Clanker' are being considered, according to Dan Romero (2025-12-22)?
options: Clanker Auctions and the existing method.
Clanker governance voting and Clanker pools.
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (12/22/25) stated they were considering 'doing this AND Clanker Auctions.'

questions.question: What were Jesse Pollak's three top priorities listed on 2025-11-26?
options: Developer infra, Neynar AI, and App studio.
Fiat on-ramps, fiat off-ramps, and token listings.
Hub stability, database optimization, and client adoption.
questions.explanation: JP (11/26/25) listed '1. Developer infra... 2. Neynar AI... 3. App studio' as top priorities.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong noted a recent shift in his AI workflow, eventually settling on a preference for which model/tool combination (2025-12-30)?
options: Claude Code in CLI using Opus 4.5.
questions.explanation: BA (12/30/25) stated his shift ended with 'claude code in cli' and noted 'opus 4.5 is just superior imho.'

questions.question: What was the key benefit of the simplified webhook filters update (2025-12-23)?
options: It allowed users to configure filters using natural language.
It enabled instant gasless deployment for new webhooks.
It automatically deployed webhooks across all L2 chains.
It restricted webhook configuration only to approved developers.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (12/23/25) explained this update helps developers use natural language to configure filters.

questions.question: In March 2024, the official Base account noted a specific milestone about their revenue. What was it?
options: They reached $1 million in total revenue.
Revenue had doubled in the previous week.
They achieved parity with Optimism's revenue.
Revenue dropped by 50% due to a holiday slump.
questions.explanation: base_official (3/15/24) stated, 'last week we doubled our revenue and I have no idea why.'

questions.question: Which specific type of client did Dan Romero note had an opportunity to emerge following Base's success as the most popular client by messages sent (2025-12-18)?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (12/18/25) concluded, 'Opportunity for another client ✅' after noting Base's popularity.

questions.question: What product was mentioned by Brian Armstrong on 2026-01-10 as being used to create his list of Farcaster besties?
questions.explanation: Brian Armstrong (1/10/26) attributed the creation of his 'top besties on Farcaster' list to '@neynar app studio.'

questions.question: According to Dan Romero's analysis on swap value capture (2026-01-09), why might the Chain layer business ultimately be undermined in value capture?
options: Regulatory uncertainty is highest at the chain level.
Asset issuers are capturing all the fees.
UX improvements at the UI layer mean consumers won't care what chain they use.
The DEX layer is becoming a non-competitive monopoly.
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (1/9/26) argued that UX improvements mean consumers prioritize 'liquidity / best price & execution,' not the specific chain.

questions.question: What was the primary function of the customized admin view that @priyanka set up within her mini app, as described by Jesse Pollak (2025-11-13)?
options: To track gas usage and transaction failures.
To see the orders coming in.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (11/13/25) said his favorite part was the 'admin view that @priyanka set up for herself to see the orders coming in.'

questions.question: What activity did Jesse Pollak suggest developers could do using the App Studio (2025-11-26)?
questions.explanation: JP (11/26/25) listed his third priority as 'App studio: vibe code mini apps.'

questions.question: What does each function page in the automated Node.js SDK documentation link back to for an easy 'Try it now' experience (2026-01-02)?
options: A list of recommended open-source developers.
A guide to setting up a local Hub.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (1/2/26) noted that each page links to the relevant API reference page and back to the SDK page.

questions.question: What was Dan Romero investigating an uptick in on 2026-01-07?
options: High gas usage from NFT mints.
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (1/7/26) issued a PSA that the 'Team is investigating an uptick in spammy notifications.'

questions.question: What was the market order spread Jesse Pollak noted for Coinbase Advanced on BTC/USD or BTC/USDC pairs (2026-01-06)?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (1/6/26) listed Coinbase Advanced at 1%.

questions.question: Which major AI tool did Dan Romero mention using as a 'cooking thought partner' quite a bit (2025-12-23)?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (12/23/25) posted: 'I’ve been using ChatGPT as a cooking thought partner quite a bit.' (The accompanying link title also mentioned Claude.)

questions.question: What activity was Brian Armstrong claiming to be doing (and losing money on) on the morning of 2025-12-29?
questions.explanation: Brian Armstrong (12/29/25) joked about 'another fine morning of buying trending tokens and losing money.'

questions.question: According to Dan Romero's 'Crypto Barbells' framework (2026-01-09), what are the two winning strategies for those in the 'speculation stack'?
options: Long-term treasury bonds or high-yield savings accounts.
Focusing only on L1 infrastructure or only on application protocols.
At-scale build for a wide audience OR specialized build for degens/whales.
Implementing better KYC/AML procedures or focusing on regulatory capture.
questions.explanation: DR (1/9/26) listed these two winning strategies based on scale or specialization.

questions.question: Why did Jesse Pollak suggest that the ability to configure webhook filters using natural language was necessary (2025-12-23)?
options: To avoid high costs associated with custom filter definitions.
To maintain compliance with centralized data providers.
To skip complex UI navigation and technical term understanding.
To ensure filters were only used by verified developers.
questions.explanation: JP (12/23/25) noted it helps developers skip 'Navigating complex UI' and 'figuring out what parent URL, parent hash, and other technical terms might mean.'

questions.question: What did Coinbase (Mircea) mention building in April 2023 to better understand how Farcaster Hubs work?
options: The first native iOS Farcaster client.
A formal specification document for Farcaster.
questions.explanation: CB (4/9/23) mentioned building 'an (incomplete) Python port of @farcaster/hub-nodejs.'

questions.question: Brian Armstrong mentioned he would change his username for a week to celebrate the launch of what product version on 2026-01-09?
questions.explanation: BA (1/9/26) stated, 'i will change my username for a week to celebrate beep v2.0.'

questions.question: Jesse Pollak mentioned that the new App Studio agent would use which capability to handle incoming webhooks and configure filters (2025-12-23)?
questions.explanation: JP (12/23/25) stated the agent will let users configure filters and handle webhooks by using natural language.

questions.question: What did Dan Romero suggest was still missing in the prediction market space, despite many tools being built (2026-01-09)?
questions.explanation: DR (1/9/26) was 'Surprised there's no clear "Axiom for prediction markets" yet.'

questions.question: Which priority for Neynar AI did Jesse Pollak list first on 2025-11-26?
questions.explanation: JP (11/26/25) listed '1. Developer infra... 2. Neynar AI: add agent capabilities, build in-feed agents on neynar.'

questions.question: Jesse Pollak noted that one of the most polished mini-apps (11/13/25) was built by whom?
questions.explanation: JP (11/13/25) praised the polished mini app and credited @priyanka for setting up the admin view.

questions.question: What specific functionality did Jesse Pollak describe that the customized mini-app built by Priyanka (11/13/25) demonstrated, suggesting a future trend?
questions.explanation: JP (11/13/25) mentioned, 'more of these transaction-enabled apps built on nas getting shipped next week.'

questions.question: Dan Romero mentioned the use of 'Claude Code' in what context on 2026-01-10?
options: As a benchmark for smart contract auditing.
As a standard for zero-knowledge proofs.
As JARVIS as a status symbol.
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (1/10/26) linked to a discussion regarding 'Claude Code as JARVIS as status symbol.'

questions.question: In Dan Romero's value capture analysis (2026-01-09), which layer is considered the most durable?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero (1/9/26) noted, 'Asset is most durable -- assuming you can maintain interest in the asset.'

questions.question: What did Jesse Pollak ask Neynar to analyze about his casts over the last year (2025-11-18)?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (11/18/25) asked Neynar to 'analyze my casts over the last year and tell me my biggest weakness.'

questions.question: What token/project did Brian Armstrong claim to have earned over 600,000 units of via an airdrop on 2025-12-31?
questions.explanation: Brian Armstrong (12/31/25) claimed 618,166.95 $BETR from the Third BETR Bomb Community Airdrop.

questions.question: Which component of the Base/Farcaster developer stack was listed first in Jesse Pollak's top priorities for Developer infra (2025-11-26)?
questions.explanation: JP (11/26/25) listed '1. Developer infra: Farcaster + onchain data' as the top priority.

questions.question: What was the key differentiator between Coinbase Advanced and Robinhood that Jesse Pollak was tracking in his post about exchanges (2026-01-06)?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (1/6/26) was inquiring about the 'lowest market order spread on BTC/USD or BTC/USDC pairs.'

questions.question: What specific request did Brian Armstrong make regarding @daimo-pay on 2025-12-31?
options: An API key for production deployment.
A bug report for a security exploit.
questions.explanation: BA (12/31/25) asked who to contact to get a dev account invite for @daimo-pay.

questions.question: In Dan Romero's value capture analysis (2026-01-09), why is the DEX layer expected to be commoditized in the medium term?
options: DEXs will become permissioned and heavily regulated.
The liquidity required to run a DEX will become prohibitively expensive.
It is inherently not too competitive, making it ripe for commoditization.
The Chain layer will absorb all DEX functionality.
questions.explanation: DR (1/9/26) stated: 'Today DEX isn't too competitive, but in the medium term expect it to be commoditized.'

questions.question: Who did Jesse Pollak credit for curating the @neynar/ui used by bots (2026-01-05)?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (1/5/26) said the UI was 'curated by the humans at neynar (all @obringer.eth really).'

questions.question: What did Coinbase's post in October 2023 confirm was minted?
questions.explanation: Coinbase (10/12/23) stated, 'I just minted Farcaster Is Open For Everyone.'

questions.question: Jesse Pollak mentioned that the new Node.js SDK documentation links back to the SDK page for what specific purpose?
options: A direct link to the security audit report.
A form to request new features.
A guide on optimizing gas usage.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak (1/2/26) said the pages link 'back to the SDK page for an easy 'Try it now' experience.'
